result.execSummary:
The defendant John L Bremness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Cargo Portion of Truck/Trailer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(d).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 court costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Not to have abusive contact with A.P.V..
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must complete a Domestic Abuse assessment if deemed necessary by Agent and comply with recommendations.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

timeConds.notes:
Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.
3 days sentence credit, if revoked.
**Per Court Order on 5/14/2021,  Defendant is to serve 44 days of the stayed jail time effective 5/3/2021.**
***Per Court Order on 6/1/2021, the 44 days of jail time released on 5/14/2021, effective 5/3/2021, is subject to Work Release.***

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office. Fine to be added to exisiting payment plan and Defendant shall continue to make $25.00 per month payments towards combined attorneys fees and fine/cost assessed.

Restitution of $599.00 plus a 10% surcharge of $59.90 for a total of $658.90 to be paid to probation while on probation. Payment plan of $50.00 per month to begin on 9/1/15 and on the 1st of each month thereafter. Restitution is joint and several with Joshua A Swagger 14CF458.
